posts.title: JIS Heritage Poster & Essay Competitions
posts.content: The Jamaica Information Service-JIS- has launched its inaugural Heritage Poster Competition, under the theme, ‘We are Free’. The competition targets secondary level students across the island from Grades 7 to 13.
posts.excerpt: The Jamaica Information Service-JIS- has launched its inaugural Heritage Poster Competition, under the theme, ‘We are Free’. The competition targets secondary level students across the island from Grades 7 to 13.

taxonomy_show.title: Roundabout JA
taxonomy_show.description: Shines the spotlight on activities across the island, particularly those carried out across Jamaica. Features a segment called “Glimpses of Jamaica” that usually offers titbits on our culture including interesting place names, folklores, heritage sites etc. Aired daily

posts.title: ESP Centre For Portland
posts.content: The next 6 months children with disabilities in Portland and surrounding parishes should have access to an Early Stimulation Programme ESP intervention centre.
posts.excerpt: The next 6 months children with disabilities in Portland and surrounding parishes should have access to an Early Stimulation Programme ESP intervention centre.

posts.title: Ebola Preparedness Mechanism
posts.content: The 2014 Ebola outbreak is the largest in history and the first Ebola epidemic the world has ever seen- affecting multiple countries in West Africa.
posts.excerpt: The 2014 Ebola outbreak is the largest in history and the first Ebola epidemic the world has ever seen- affecting multiple countries in West Africa.

posts.title: Additional $95 Million to Assist Farmers
posts.content: Cabinet approves another $95 million to help the Agriculture Sector bounce back from the recent drought conditions.
posts.excerpt: Cabinet approves another $95 million to help the Agriculture Sector bounce back from the recent drought conditions.

posts.title: JHW Sept 29 – Oct 3
posts.content: Prime Minister Portia Simpson Miller convened a special meeting at Jamaica House to review the Health Ministry’s preparedness mechanisms for the Ebola virus disease.
posts.excerpt: Prime Minister Portia Simpson Miller convened a special meeting at Jamaica House to review the Health Ministry’s preparedness mechanisms for the Ebola virus disease.

taxonomy_show.title: Jamaica House Weekly
taxonomy_show.description: Provides a recap of activities of the Prime Minister and other Ministers within the OPM, in the previous week. Aired Sundays

posts.title: Food and Safety Officer
posts.content: On today’s programme Senior Plant and Food Security Officer at the Rural Agricultural Development Authority (RADA), Francine Webb, shares how she channeled her interest in insects into a rewarding career.
posts.excerpt: On today’s programme Senior Plant and Food Security Officer at the Rural Agricultural Development Authority (RADA), Francine Webb, shares how she channeled her interest in insects into a rewarding career.

posts.title: P.M. Lead National Chikungunya Clean-up Day Activities
posts.title_plain: P.M. Lead National Chikungunya Clean-up Day Activities
posts.content: Prime Minister to lead national Chikungunya clean-up day activities; Caribbean Association of Housing Finance Institutions to host two-day conference in Jamaica, and Prime Minister commends Digicel Foundation.
posts.excerpt: Prime Minister to lead national Chikungunya clean-up day activities; Caribbean Association of Housing Finance Institutions to host two-day conference in Jamaica, and Prime Minister commends Digicel Foundation.

posts.title: JSIF Disburses Close to 2-Billion For Poverty Alleviation
posts.title_plain: JSIF Disburses Close to 2-Billion For Poverty Alleviation
posts.content: JSIF disburses close to 2- Billion dollars for Poverty Alleviation & Community Development Projects, students receive scholarships from Area 4 police and farmers urge to help fight rhizome rot.
posts.excerpt: JSIF disburses close to 2- Billion dollars for Poverty Alleviation & Community Development Projects, students receive scholarships from Area 4 police and farmers urge to help fight rhizome rot.

posts.title: JPs and Their Role As Agents Of Peace
posts.title_plain: JPs and Their Role As Agents Of Peace
posts.content: Governor-General, Sir Patrick Allen, says Justices of the Peace-JPs-, who are Ministers of Religion, must begin playing their role of being agents of peace in a meaningful way.
posts.excerpt: Governor-General, Sir Patrick Allen, says Justices of the Peace-JPs-, who are Ministers of Religion, must begin playing their role of being agents of peace in a meaningful way.

posts.title: Sawmill Licensing
posts.content: Effective January 2015, All sawmill and power saw operators will have to get a license from the Forestry Department to operate legally in Jamaica.
posts.excerpt: Effective January 2015, All sawmill and power saw operators will have to get a license from the Forestry Department to operate legally in Jamaica.

taxonomy_show.title: Get the Facts
taxonomy_show.description: 3 – 5 minute feature providing useful tips on varied topics including ease of doing business with the government, for example how to apply for a passport, drivers license, CARICOM skills certificate. Also offers tips for householders – energy conservation, disposing of pesticides. Get the Facts is written in a “step-by – step” format, with a view to making tips easy for listeners to retain and follow.

posts.title: Decline Of Irish Potato Imports Since 2008
posts.title_plain: Decline Of Irish Potato Imports Since 2008
posts.content: Imports of Irish potatos have fallen from 9.3 million kilograms in 2008 to 2.2 million kilograms in 2013. This is the result of a successful strategy by the government to boost local production.
posts.excerpt: Imports of Irish potatos have fallen from 9.3 million kilograms in 2008 to 2.2 million kilograms in 2013. This is the result of a successful strategy by the government to boost local production.

posts.title: Jamaica Sport Technical Committee Launched
posts.content: Jamaica sport technical committee launched, Development Activities to be fully streamlined by 2017, and Government remains committed to supporting the MSME sector.
posts.excerpt: Jamaica sport technical committee launched, Development Activities to be fully streamlined by 2017, and Government remains committed to supporting the MSME sector.

posts.title: P.M. Gets Update On Threat of Ebola Virus To Jamaica
posts.title_plain: P.M. Gets Update On Threat of Ebola Virus To Jamaica
posts.content: Prime Minister gets update on threat of ebola virus to Jamaica; Industry, Investment and Commerce Ministry to sensitize Diaspora about Logistics hub initiative; and employers urged to held reduce gender pay gap.

posts.title: High School Sports Infrastructure Improvement Project Update
posts.title_plain: High School Sports Infrastructure Improvement Project Update
posts.content: On today’s edition of Sports Spotlight we get an update on recent activities being undertaken under the High School Sports Infrastructure Improvement Programme (HSSIIP) at the Tarrant and Calabar High Schools.
